result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy J Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Agent to determine what programs defendant needs to complete.
No abusive contact with minor children.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Randy J Schuster

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 11:12 a.m.  Defendant Randy J Schuster in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich - 30 days of conditional jail time - 1 yr of probation, no abusive contact with children, anger management or domestic violence program, AODA assessment, $28 restitution.  Huff addresses state's requests.  Huff disagrees with jail time.  Agrees with probation.  Mr. Schuster addresses the court. Court orders  S/W probation one year, conditions, restitution $28, court costs $243, agent to determine what programs defendant needs to complete. 6 days conditional jail time, huber allowed, start on or before July 3, 2015 at 7:00 p.m.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.  No abusive contact with children.

11:12 Defendant Randy J Schuster in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich will file amended information charging misd battery. Def will plead guilty to amended charge. Probation and asking for conditional jail time. Atty Huff agrees.  Def agrees.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Def pleas guilty to charge that will be contained in the amended information.   Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  Court finds and adjudicates def guilty of amended charge of misd battery. Sentencing will be held on May 5, 2015 at 11:00 a.m. Counsel agrees 10 days jail CAP. 11:23

Final pre-trial at 05-05-2015 11:00 am.
Status conference at 04-14-2015 11:00 am.
Jury trial - 12 person at 05-21-2015 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 05-22-2015 08:30 am.

10:06 Defendant Randy J Schuster in court with attorney Charles S. Huff.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court this matter needs to be reset. Get a new jury trial date, final pretrial date and status conference. Huff states this matter might be close to a resolution.
from Judge Boles
For Continuance filed by Sean Froelich
filed by Sean Froelich
criminal jury trial scheduling order
Pre-trial conference on August 5, 2014 at 04:00 pm.
for Continuance in letter form filed by Charles Huff
Pre-trial conference on July 29, 2014 at 10:45 am.
filed by Sean Froelich
Pre-trial conference on July 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Def pleas not guilty. Court enters in not guilty plea. Bond to continue in it's current form and amount. Def to remain until he is handed a notice of hearing. Court goes over bond conditions with Def.

11:06 Defendant Randy J Schuster in court with attorney Charles S Huff.  Sean E Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Darren Ekholm swn and ex by Froelich. ID's Def. Court will reflect indentification of Def. Huff x ex. Huff gives argument. Court; based on testimony; finds the defendant did probably commit a felony, binds the def over for trial. Froelich files information; Def has a copy. Court read charges and maximum penalties. Def waives further reading.
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Def voluntarily waives his time limits for a preliminary hearing
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

10:08 am   
Defendant Randy J Schuster in court with attorney Charles S Huff.  Rory E O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant has copy of complaint  Defendant waives reading of the complaint  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Huff objects to the bond with no contact conditions.  There is a family matter.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 11:00 am.
